Reviews.Title: “good price”
Reviews.Author: aidni
Reviews.Content: in the middle of nothing not bad, not good good prices compared with services people are really kind free internet restaurant inside, not bad, not good ... they use a terrible oil (sure that it is not olive oil ...) could be nice to renovate it and clean more and more, rooms above all it is ok if you have to stay here just a couple of nights

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable brief stay”
Reviews.Author: TLG444
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last week for one night on a business trip. I checked in at 10pm and checked out at 9am. The room was nice and clean. The pillows on the bed were awesome, better than I have at home. The free wireless internet worked very well. I ordered the continental breakfast from room service, it arrived quickly and included a croissant, muffin, juice or coffee and a melon wedge. More than I needed but all were fresh and tasty. Overall I have no complaints and expect I will stay again since it is located very close to the office I need to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if you can”
Reviews.Author: Hothockeymom
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for a hockey tournament and can honestly say that I probably would not recommend or stay here again. The food and restaurant are overpriced, slow and not worth the cost. The wait staff was slow and disorganized and apparently one quit in the midst of serving us. Another reason I would stay is cause it took 4 days to get the hold this hotel put on my credit card off. This is ridiculous and once I left and they checked the room it should have been off my card. Next year we will find a better hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “In Anjou...east end hotel...residential area...not best location for tourists”
Reviews.Author: Pissedoffdad
Reviews.Content: Been going there almost every other month for a number of years now, and have found this hotel to be a good choice as far as being clean and the staff friendly. The food is crap to be honest, and pricey so if you want good food go elsewhere, venture out, Montreal has an abundance of great places to eat...this just is NOT one of them. It has 2 levels of parking in the rear, with the upper floor being a secure floor that can be locked should you want extra security for your car, do not know if they charge extra for this...do call them to inquire. It is in a low crime area, so there isn't really any need for it unless you are a worrier. Very close, (about 1000 yards), to a major shopping mall "Les Galleries d'Anjou". Book early as the place fills quickly on weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: SamuelChamplain
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for one night on a business trip. The place is nice and the personnel is very friendly and helpfull. It is located very next to a large highway so the "humming" noise of passing cars is always present. There is nothing much around if you want access within a 5 minutes walk, but there are many commercial streets nearby accessible by car. The room and bathroom were clean and well equiped. The rooms are identical to the Comfort Inn type of room, maybe better equiped. The only major problem I had was with the wireless internet connection which continuously broke off and was extremely slow.

Reviews.Title: “ONE WORD "AWESOME"”
Reviews.Author: Willy J
Reviews.Content: You know that you have landed a great location when you feel that youâ€™re at home far away from home. I stayed at the Quality Hotel for 3 days, it took only a few hours before the staff started calling me by my name, i felt as if everyone knew me. Front desk staff goes beyond their call of duty to make your day. The rooms were clean and confortable. I travel alot and i gotta admit that service in this place makes the whole difference. Love it..

Reviews.Title: “No guarantee of smoking rooms if only selected "non-smoking preference"”
Reviews.Author: stardustcross
Reviews.Content: See title. Went to Montreal for my birthday and found out "non-smoking preference" actually means you COULD get a non-smoking room, but if they're all out, you're getting smoking room which is incredibly dumb. In theory, the hotel could sell every single room as "non-smoking preference" even if only 75% of them are smoke-free! That said, there was a smoke-free room available on the first night, which we agreed to stay in until the second day when we would move to the smoking room. (We checked out the smoking floor/room to see how it'd be and asides from smoke, it's the smell of intense air fresheners.) Turns out, on the second day, a smoke-free room freed up, although we had to move rooms, it wasn't much trouble given we packed light for the weekend. Overall, the hotel isn't bad... it's nothing fancy but I feel it's a bit expensive for comparative hotels closer to the downtown core, that might have more amenities. This hotel's close to the highway, but nothing else...some box malls/plazas with food. Feels like industrial mixed with suburbia. It's not a terrible stay but it's boring. The rooms are really generic with no style but it's a decent level of "clean", so reflects a 3-star hotel for the most part. The parking IS a bit sketchy... apparently they said the back is "safer" but it doesn't really feel that way. It feels like if you get mugged there no one would even see. Apparently car thefts/break-ins are common in Montreal!? Anyway, we managed to get the spots in the front on both nights because people usually go in and out. It was good, no problems. Bonus points - the staff are overall pretty nice and bi-lingual (at the least - I think one girl knew Italian!). The bar staff were also happy to open some drinks I purchased off-site because I didn't have an opener so props for them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: rcs67
Reviews.Content: We booked into the Quality (Inn) Hotel in Anjou during a visit to Montreal visiting relatives. Having rented a car and driven up from Vermont, my partner and I were very happy with how easy it was to get to. The front desk staff were almost perfect - always friendly and offering assistance, both in French and in English. We had a strange schedule, so we checked in and out 3 times during our week in Montreal, and so we got to see how many of them did. (Frank and Anita - whom we saw multiple times - were especially good to work with.) The rooms weren't spectacular but were quite fine - we had an "executive" room so we had a small seating area (loveseat), as well as a small fridge in the room. It was perfect for us, giving us somewhere to sit and relax (and watch bilingual TV) aside from being on the bed, as well as somewhere to store sodas and snacks. Other basics: There is open parking on property, as well as a "secure" area on the top deck of their ramp. There is a shopping center (mall) close by, as well as Le Marche Les Halles d'Anjou for a more European shopping experience. Great restaurants in the area, as well as coffee shops, etc. Easy access to freeways, as well as surface streets into Downtown and Old Town Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: 2-time_aruba_visitor
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel considering the price. Awesome and very helpful front desk staff. Free parking. Clean rooms, comfortable bed, nice AC, fast WiFi (also free of charge.) Efficient restaurant. Near major mall. Not too far from downtown and easy bus ride to the Metro. I only wish they had a fridge int he room and more american TV channels. But with fast WiFi TV is not really needed - everything can be viewed online

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet, Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: judyjudyjudy9
Reviews.Content: Knowing this is a group hotel, we stayed while attending a swimming competition at the Claude Robillard Sport Complex. Front Desk staff were welcoming, friendly and helpful. Rooms comfortable and clean and adequate. Free Parking a big bonus, high speed included also. Easy access to shopping mall and main arteries. Downside is the hotel restaurant, which quite possibly be leased. Expensive, small portions, expensive beer and waitress added her own 15% tip to our bill.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied over all”
Reviews.Author: Cachouu
Reviews.Content: The hotel stands of the chain's reputation. Just spent a weekend in Montreal to visit few family members living in the eastern part of the city, they recommended the hotel as the nearest to their residency, reservation was made on the internet, confirmed over the phone afterwards, check in was smooth and staff at the front desk was quiet friendly,,,,the room had no surprises; neat, bed had a pleasant scent and bathroom was shiny clean. The restaurant offered a varied menu, we only had breakfast wich was very good , service was a bit slow this weekend though. I have'nt expect more and I have'nt got less either however the friendliness of the staff was outsdanding, overall you get what you pay for in a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but has a few drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: JimDavisHouston
Reviews.Content: Rooms are clean, beds are firm and comfortable, and somewhat quiet. There is a very nice on site restaruant. Not much on TV if you don't understand French. I had a few issues on my 3 day stay. I love my coffee in the morning, but when I looked at the coffee maker, it was full of stagnant water, and didn't work. I mentioned it to the front desk, but the water remained in the pot for my entire stay. Free internet, but very slow, and it disconnects every 15 minutes or so. I live in a warm climate, and am not used to the cold and snow. But if you have it, you should tryto control it ! It snowed every day. The walkway was clear in front of the front door, and that was it. Walkways and parking lot were covered with a layer of snow, and solid ice under. Walking to and from the car with a 25lb shoulder case every day was treachorous. The constant slipping caused a miserable neck and backache. It's a relitively nice stay if you don't have to go outside.

Reviews.Title: “First, Second and Third Hand Smoke... And did I mention Smoke?”
Reviews.Author: Shwami
Reviews.Content: I've been staying here on and off for 11 years. Each time I enjoy it a bit less, but it is convenient to my job. First the good: Staying on the south-west side, and on an upper (8th and 9th) floor provides a decent city-lights view and a cool breeze through the mini, drive through size, sliding window common to the Comfort/Quality chain. The sheets are clean and the beds are decently firm. The on-site 'Graffitis' restaurant offers some decent fare, Parking is abundant and free. Now the bad: Virtually the entire hotel reeks of stale cigarettes, especially the elevators. I would not be surprised to learn that the hotel has been declared a 'cancer hot-spot' by the UN. I always stay on the upper floors for the view, but if you should shut off the A/C the smell of french 90 proof cigarettes will permeate your jockeys if left hanging from your bedside lamp shade. Talk about a smokin' a$$! Luggage must be lugged up stairs and through narrow,non-automatic doors if you enter by any but the main entrance; so no handicap accessibility except through the front of the hotel, while most parking is located around back. Rooms are sparsely furnished: No fridge (unless you pay $5 per day) or microwave. TV's are of the flat panel type that make everyone on TV look like Rosie O'Donnell and their volume levels rise and fall based on ambient sounds in the room (An annoying feature that has you constantly adjusting the volume to avoid furniture being hurled against your walls by guests in adjacent rooms (or nearby apartment complexes). Wireless internet is free, but slow at times. So, if you still like the deep, sexy hack and smell of a Camel, you'll love the joint. On the other hand, if you love life and crisp, clean Canadian air, visit the nearby oil and gasoline storage tanks and refineries. And, any connection between Quality Hotel and 'Olympic Parc' is tenuous at best. Although, admittedly, they are both located in the province of Quebec.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary!”
Reviews.Author: BrigitteAlabama
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights over a weekend. We were there for the Montreal Marathon. After reading all the reviews, we decided to give this hotel a try no matter what. We enjoy our stay and would go back to the same hotel without any problem. Our room was well located on the 7th with view of the rear deck parking lot. Our housekeeper was very nice and so was the staff at the front desk. Stores and restaurants near by. We fell in love with the place!

Reviews.Title: “Not worh the price”
Reviews.Author: Rob1957
Reviews.Content: Staff was helpfull, suggesting we take a different room than selected because there was a large group on that floor. Hotel seems to cater to large groups, we saw 2 ot 4 busses parked in front most days. Room was clean but carpet needed cleaning or replacing. Noise wasn't too bad, maybe because we were on the 8th floor. WiFi unreliable at best. Housekeeping not quite up to par.

Reviews.Title: “Never EVER stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Musikovida
Reviews.Content: Our very large family booked rooms at this hotel because we were attending a wedding and it was very convenient location for getting to the ceremony and reception. After the bookings were made, I decided to read the reviews here on TripAdvisor. BELIEVE THE HORROR STORIES!!! Although the staff and the rooms were fine, the first thing I noticed is that there are no safes in the rooms. This was my cue to keep all my valuables with me throughout the weekend, which I did. Unfortunately, not all of our family members did so. The end result was that, at 3am, they returned to one of the rooms to discover jewelry, a laptop, wallets and bags stolen from the room. (The thief was kind enough to take my brother in-law's license and registration out so he could still drive home the next day.) The cleaning lady explained that a man came into the room that afternoon and claimed to be the occupant, at which point she left. However, she was unable to describe him when asked. It's interesting to note that we left at 2pm, the shift change at the hotel occurred at 3:30pm, and purchases were made on the stolen credit cards at 4pm. Inside job....? The bottom line is that nobody should have to go through this kind of hassle. Unless you arrive without a car or any other valuables, FIND ANOTHER HOTEL TO STAY AT! Your cars and personal belongings cannot be trusted here!

Reviews.Title: “Bring Your Earplugs!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sudriveraine
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights last weekend. We were in Montreal to visit friends and family and had chosen the hotel because its location was convenient to the homes of the people we meant to visit, in Montreal's East end. The hotel is easy to find, which is a plus. It has lots of free parking, a plus in a city where parking is a concern. The front desk staff was polite and efficient but not especially friendly or helpful. They quickly found our reservation and gave us room keys. Our room was on the 6th floor near the elevators. I was concerned we would get a lot of noise from the elevators but I need not have worried: any elevator noise was drowned out by noise from the nearby highway. Someone must have forgotten to soundproof this hotel! Now I know to expect some noise when staying at a hotel in a big city but this was horrible; we woke up whenever a truck or emergency vehicle drove by! Apart from that problem the room itself was fine. It was clean and fairly adequately supplied (only the pillows were all too soft for our taste). The air conditioning was noisy but worked well. The furniture and walls showed some wear and tear and the carpet was obviously older but nothing out of the ordinary for a budget hotel. There is a restaurant on property but due to its unimaginative offerings and high prices we didn't try it out. Montreal is full of excellend dining options so we didn't need to anyhow! Would we go back? Only if we couldn't find anything better.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay in Montreal - Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TSeconds
Reviews.Content: This hotel is extremely nice. I stayed there for a week, which really made my visit to Montreal, a beautiful city, very enjoyable. The hotel is in a very convenient location just off the metropolitan highway. The rooms are QUITE comfortable and VERY clean. The service at the hotel is also superior, whether it is the front desk or room service personal. The hotel is about 2 minutes away from a huge shopping compound, 5 minutes away from the Olympic Park and about 15 minutes away from the heart of downtown. The hotel has a very nice (real fine food with a great price). I would definitely recommend this hotel if you are visiting Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Good times”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkMiley1
Reviews.Content: In reading multiple reviews, I did not know what to expect. When we got there, we were very pleasantly surprised! The hotel was very well kept, the rooms were comfortable, and the staff was very pleasant. We just got back from a 3 days stay at the Quality Hotel East and it was absolutely wonderful.The rooms were clean. The Graffiti Resto Bar was amazing and the staff were always working to make sure everything was ok.I would highly recommend staying at Quality Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Place, Awful Location,”
Reviews.Author: AdamMack
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Quality Olympic Park , for business reason. We usually travel with choice hotels. This location is awful hotel. The staff was lost, the could not find my reservation at first. Then it took an eternaty to check in. The supervisor didn't even know what to do, has as lost as the staff, I beleive is name was Micheal. The hotel doesn't seem to be professionally run This is just not what I expect from a hotel. It looks more like a cheap motel. The bed is uncomfortable and the linen looks dirty too. They have a restaurant Graffiti in the hotel and the food was awful. The service was slow and the staff could barely speak english. All in all it's A BAD place to stay at. We are never going back. Awful, Awful place hotel, don't go there and don't refer any.

Reviews.Title: “The Quality Hotel really stands up to the name”
Reviews.Author: Media1
Reviews.Content: I booked a room thru Expedia.ca at the Quality Hotel Montreal East for the first weekend of december. It was my first time stying at Quality hotel, i usualy stay at Mariott or Sheraton Hotels. I got to tell you my experience was really suprising in a very good way. The staff where so warm and welcoming, the rooms where very well equiped and clean and the restaurant affordable and delicious. For the price i will surely consider the Quality Hotel Montreal East for my next business trip to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Far cry from a 3 star, more like a 1 1/2 star motel”
Reviews.Author: Tom_Stm
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for it's convenient location for work related trip. The service at this hotel was poor from the moment we arrived. The staff is not very enthusiastic about their job. The quality of breakfast and room service was weak by 3 star hotel standards. The lady barely spoke english at their Graffiti's restaurant . The rooms are small and out dated. The queen bed is more like a double bed. There was a funny odor in the hallway. At check out it took an eternity to get our receipt. To Add insult to injury was the fact that the hotel manager walked by us as his staff was visibly having trouble checking us out and said nor did anything about it. So you could image why the staff is what it is. One of the bigger problems with this hotel was the noise level. . We asked for a quiet room. We unfortunately were put in front of the elevator (was probably built in the 70's for how slow it was), though I don't think another room would have made a difference. Take all these aspect into consideration before booking this so called hotel. At 125$ plus taxes, this hotel is far from good. It's more like a siesta motel.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is not recommended, stay away at all cost”
Reviews.Author: James0555
Reviews.Content: I travel quite a bit for work and booked this hotel trough their web site. I looked it up on trip advidsor and the last couple of reviews were good. To my great suprise, this hotel is out dated, far from the 3 star they say they are. The service is awful and the staff all the way to management don't know what tey are doing. Were do I begin: The room: The rooms are quite small, I called the desk to change room and tey told me all the rooms are the same size. The bathroom floor had hair on it, there was a funny smell in the hallway, the carpet was fulty, the elevator are extremely slow, I think they were built in 1950. So , I called the desk again, they told that housekeeping was gone fo the day and that they were full so they could not do anything for now. This was just hawful. The Restaurant " Graffiti's" in the hotel is very expensive, the portion are small, the service is slow. The waitress could barely talk english and the food is not very good. At check out, I asked to speak to the manager, I beleive his name is Micheal, told him about my stay. He offered a 20% discount, when they have 100% satisfaction garantee policy. He didn't even try to apoligize. He was extremely rude and and unprofessional. To all, avoid the this hotel at all cost.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic deal”
Reviews.Author: Lefty_59
Reviews.Content: What a deal! I had never been at this location but when I saw Expedia's great offer, I just couldn't resist. The rate is usually aound $100.00 but I paid only $54.50. I really didn't expect much for this price. When I checked in, I asked if I would get the same quality room even though I had paid half price and I got what I believe to be one of the best deals ever. The room was average size but extremely clean and the bed very comfortable. I have included pictures. I have read other comments saying that there was a lot of noise. This definitely was not the case for me. I asked at the reception for a quiet room and I was given one in the back. I would certainly return but only if I could find a similar deal. I always check different websites and usually find similar offers.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy Rooms”
Reviews.Author: ffriend
Reviews.Content: The rooms are NOT clean. The pull out bed had black hairs all over the sheets as if they were not changed. The bathroom floor also had black hairs. The toilet had dried human feces on the top and bottom of the seat. When I called housekeeping to ask for 8 towels (there was 4 of us in the room) I was informed that they do not give out that many towels. She later came back with 4 towels. I am paying for the room! I want 2 towels per person! I can overlook the terrible view (of the highway) or the slow service in the restuarant but the housekeeping was inexcusable! The only saving grace was that the staff at the front desk were helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: djfan
Reviews.Content: Based on other reviews, we were dreading our arrival for Grand Prix weekend (the busiest weekend of the year). We were pleasantly surprised. The staff was friendly/helpful. The rooms were adequate in size. We had no issues with the elevators (we made numerous trips daily, for 5 days). Although our room faced the highway, we couldn't hear it (we live in a quiet place and were worried about that). I guess if you opened the window, it would be a problem...but we had the A/C on and it was fine. The restaurant is not the finest in Montreal, but the staff was attentive and the food was fine. We even tried Room Service. It arrived in less than 20 minutes (did I say it was the busiest weekend of the year?) and it was hot. The only complaint is that it isn't close to a Metro stop, but the front desk attendant told me which Metro stop had free parking, and gave me clear directions how to get there. Clean, efficient, safe. We had a wonderful visit.

Reviews.Title: “a number of problems”
Reviews.Author: Northman11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very clean and staff friendly but don't believe their claim about rooms being spacious. believe me... they are not. Rooms are noisy because this hotel is located right beside Auotroute#40 - a major thoroughfare through Montreal. The traffic is going 24 hrs a day. Bring your ear plugs. Elevators are slow especially if you have a room on the 7th or 8th floor. The food in the dining room is very average and service is indifferent and slow. I definitely would pick another spot to stay in Montreal when I go to Montreal again.

HotelInfo.Name: Quality Hotel Montreal East / Olympic Parc
HotelInfo.Address: 8100 Avenue Neuville | Anjou, Montreal, Quebec H1J 2T2, Canada
